H0.text: What word is traditionally applied to clothes and linen collected by a woman before her marriage. Dowry

H1.text: What word is traditionally applied to clothes and linen collected by a woman before her marriage. Trunk

H2.text: What word is traditionally applied to clothes and linen collected by a woman before her marriage. Hope Chest

H3.text: What word is traditionally applied to clothes and linen collected by a woman before her marriage. Trousseau

A5.text: The wardrobe and belongings of a bride, including the wedding dress or similar clothing

A6.text: A hope chest, also called dowry chest, cedar chest, trousseau chest, or glory box, is a piece of furniture once commonly used by unmarried young women to collect items, such as clothing and household linen, in anticipation of married life.

A7.text: A trousseau was a common coming-of-age rite until approximately the 1950s; it was typically a step on the road to marriage between courting a man and engagement.
